Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
Gotta say, the possibilities of the asset chain parameters are pretty exciting!

Loving the idea of doing disposable, short-term blockchains for rapid projects, tied to a long-term ecosystem currency for payouts.

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
Are there any plans to split ``ac_perc`` so that you can have one percentage for blocks mined, and another for transactions?

Seems like it'd be useful...?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: why?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: there is not always a block reward.

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: You might want to have a higher pubkey reward for miner activity, but a lower reward for end-user activity, so that business developers can separate out the different audiences in their financial structure.

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
For gateway deposit I have to call `z_sendmany` where as first parameter I have to input wallet address from which I'm sending funds. This method "not super clever" and if funds on other address I'm just receive `"message": "Could not find any non-coinbase UTXOs to spend."` in `z_getoperationstatus`.
For now I found only solution like a:
1) get all addresses list
`./komodo-cli getaddressesbyaccount ""`
2) check balance for each address and provide user table `address - balance` so he'll able to choose needed address which will be used in `z_sendmany`

Other idea to `getaccountaddress` send whole balance on it and then use this address in z_sendmany - but user will lose txfee on each call

Is there some native call to get list of addresses with balances to assist user with sending address choice - maybe I'm missing something?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
Oh call `listaddressgroupings` looks like right what I need
Question ^^ isn't actual )

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: yep

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
listaddressgroupings is primarily to show which addresses are linked together (the first layer of arrays are organized according to relationships)

But it does that the side use of determining which addresses have which amount.

The other method I can remember off the top of my head is to do `listaddresses`, and then do a `getbalance` of each address, which may not be bad in a script, but isn't as useful in the terminal.

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
Another question, in addition to the first:

could you set `ac_decay` above 100000000? That would make it so that the block reward increases over time. 

Not sure why you might want a coin that's scarce at first, and then becomes less valuable over time...

but I guess that's what governments do, with inflation. 

Maybe you'd want some inflation, so people are inclined not to hold the asset for too long, but instead keep it moving...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ac_decay I think is capped at 25%

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you can just look at the code for such basic questions

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: How does one specifiy a `-datadir` for a new assetchain?   komodod is stuck on "waiting for datadir" even if i create one with the name for the new assetchain to work with.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
e.g.
```
komodod -ac_name=MYLO555 -ac_supply=555555 -datadir=~/.komodo/NODE2 -addnode=172.18.0.2 -gen -genproclimit=1 &
[1] 33
user@3986ed016f72:~/.komodo$ waiting for datadir
>>>>>>>>>> MYLO555: p2p.15633 rpc.15634 magic.aa3b7cf8 2856025336 555555 coins
^C
user@3986ed016f72:~/.komodo$ waiting for datadir
^C
user@3986ed016f72:~/.komodo$ waiting for datadir

```

Use case:  shared data volume to two different machines in enterprise env.

Author: Nabob#5004
Content: check Node2 folder created before launch, i prefer to give absolute path

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Mylo specify datadir and conf

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Mylo and don't use ~ because sometimes that causes problems

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i ran into some bugs with datadir + conf in regtest mode, i had to specify both

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: sick thanks will test it out

Author: pbca26#5430

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
no such luck on both counts
```
user@3986ed016f72:~/.komodo$ komodod -ac_name=MYLO555 -ac_supply=555555 -datadir=/home/user/.komodo/NODE2 -conf=/home/user/.komodo/NODE2/MYLO555.conf -addnode=172.18.0.2 -gen -genproclimit=1 &
[1] 39
user@3986ed016f72:~/.komodo$ waiting for datadir
>>>>>>>>>> MYLO555: p2p.15633 rpc.15634 magic.aa3b7cf8 2856025336 555555 coins
waiting for datadir
waiting for datadir
```
will play around with it, if you've both suggested something there's probably a magical combo of things that will kick it through

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: needed a conf file written first  ‚úÖ

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Mylo look at how regtest stuff works

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: at what level?

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: in src?

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: or just how it spits stuff out?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: https://github.com/jl777/komodo/blob/master/qa/rpc-tests/cryptoconditions.py#L33

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: regtest uses -conf and -datadir

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: -datadir is added in a different file, those are "extra args" added to the default ones

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: ok cheers

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i think kmd gets confused when not given both datadir + conf

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: because there is logic to auto-calculate some stuff from AC name

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: such as, the AC "BOBSTUFF" will always have the same rpc port, it's calculated from the name

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: this also applies to file+directory structures for AC's

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: so if you don't specify everything, things get confused. This is my guess as to what is going on

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: ok.   i can sorta see how you come to that conclusion.   in the past when i've tested stuff i've had to be very specific to get what i expect, but othertimes i'm a little bit 'huh?' and just continued without being too bothered if i didn't get my way.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i had to do some special magic to get asset chains working with the KMD test suite

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: the Zcash test suite we inherited never had any idea of such a thing

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: make sure the datadir has correct permissions (not owned by root on accident/etc)

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: nice.  so general improvements all around.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: this is some of the magic, or some would call it "an ugly hack" üòÉ https://github.com/jl777/komodo/blob/master/qa/rpc-tests/test_framework/util.py#L226

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: but it makes things work

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: REGTEST always has the same rpc port, but Zcash test suite wants to give every regtest daemon a random port, so I had to route around that

Author: joey#9690
Content: @Deleted User @grewalsatinder @polycryptoblog @blackjok3r @CrisF I put together a pretty neat idea, requesting some feedback on it https://github.com/metacoin/parallel-pow

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Sounds like merge mining

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Not a bad idea, someone porposed something similar for the early days of the scaletest... as the mining power required was the limiting factor there, and someone suggessted to merge mine all the AC with a single miner. Cutting the required CPUs down by like 8000x

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: LOL

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: yes, that way I can own most of the ac chains at once üòà

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: the down side of that idea, though, is that PIRATE likely wouldn't have near the hashrate it has

Author: joey#9690
Content: Similar to merge mining, except with merge mining, the hashrate isn't added together and the parent chain doesn't gain from exclusive hashrate on the childchain

Author: joey#9690
Content: How are AC chains secured?

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: many use dPoW through the use of notary nodes

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: Some are secure by both massive hash and dPoW

Author: joey#9690
Content: Right, I remember reading about this now, thank you

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Yes STAKED is extremly sercure like Verus, although not quite as good as VERUS.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Or at least it will be when its launched for real.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: we are using all PoW chains for current testing, just for ease of setup.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: VRSC is the ticker if that's what you mean

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: more like a mining signalling protocol than merge mining.   how would parallel-pow deal with small chain re-orgs for the parallel consensus proof chain or would they be mining on delayed (already re-orgd) blocks?  would this dilute the value of some of the higher value chains because the high value motivates the miners to mine it?

Author: joey#9690
Content: @Mylo there's only one nonce, and one proof-of-work, so a re-org of PoW on one chain would re-org all chains. I think that's fine, set the block time high like with bitcoin and use FIBRE and you have close to zero reorgs ever (like bitcoin)
